get.summary: VerifyProviderTokenFrom verifies that a token has been created for a provider since given timestamp
VerifyProviderTokenFrom verifies that a token has been created for a provider since given timestamp

parameters.description: cursor is the cursor to use for the page of results, empty if at the beginning

parameters.description: CreateRuleTypeRequest is the request to create a rule type.

parameters.description: UpdateRuleTypeRequest is the request to update a rule type.

type.title:
type is the type of the data evaluation.
Right now only `jq` is supported as a driver

jq.description:
jq is only used if the `jq` type is selected.
It defines the comparisons that are made between
the ingested data and the profile rule.

rego.description: rego is only used if the `rego` type is selected.

vulncheck.description: vulncheck is only used if the `vulncheck` type is selected.

homoglyphs.description: homoglyphs is only used if the `homoglyphs` type is selected.

DefinitionEval.description:
Eval defines the data evaluation definition.
This pertains to the way we traverse data from the upstream
endpoint and how we compare it to the rule.

type.description:
type is the type of the data ingestion.
we currently support rest, artifact and builtin.

rest.description:
rest is the rest data ingestion.
this is only used if the type is rest.

builtin.description: builtin is the builtin data ingestion.

artifact.description: artifact is the artifact data ingestion.

git.description: git is the git data ingestion.

diff.description: diff is the diff data ingestion.

DefinitionIngest.description: Ingest defines how the data is ingested.

name.description: name is the name of the ecosystem.

depfile.title: depfile is the file that contains the dependencies for this ecosystem

ingested.title: Ingested points to the data retrieved in the `ingest` section

profile.description: Profile points to the profile itself.

type.description:
type is the type of evaluation engine to use
for rego. We currently have two modes of operation:
- deny-by-default: this is the default mode of operation
  where we deny access by default and allow access only
  if the profile explicitly allows it. It expects the
  profile to set an `allow` variable to true or false.
- constraints: this is the mode of operation where we
  allow access by default and deny access only if a
  violation is found. It expects the profile to set a
  `violations` variable with a "msg" field.

def.description: def is the definition of the rego profile.

violationFormat.description:
how are violations reported. This is only used if the
`constraints` type is selected. The default is `text`
which returns human-readable text. The other option is
`json` which returns a JSON array containing the violations.

type.title: entity is the entity to get status for. Incompatible with `all`

id.title: id is the ID of the entity to get status for. Incompatible with `all`

GetProfileStatusByNameRequestEntityTyped.title:
EntiryTypeId is a message that carries an ID together with a type to uniquely identify an entity
such as (repo, 1), (artifact, 2), ...
if the struct is reused in other messages, it should be moved to a top-level definition

type.description: type is the type of the rule to be instantiated.

params.description:
params are the parameters that are passed to the rule.
This is optional and depends on the rule type.

def.description:
def is the definition of the rule.
This depends on the rule type.

name.title: name is the descriptive name of the rule, not to be confused with type

ProfileRule.description: Rule defines the individual call of a certain rule type.

exclude.title: List of actions to exclude from the replacement

action.title: how to patch the file. For now, only replace is supported

mode.title:
the GIT mode of the file. Not UNIX mode! String because the GH API also uses strings
the usual modes are: 100644 for regular files, 100755 for executable files and
040000 for submodules (which we don't use but now you know the meaning of the 1 in 100644)
see e.g. https://github.com/go-git/go-git/blob/32e0172851c35ae2fac495069c923330040903d2/plumbing/filemode/filemode.go#L16

method.title:
the method to use to create the PR. For now, these are supported:
-- minder.content - ensures that the content of the file is exactly as specified
                    refer to the Content message for more details
-- minder.actions.replace_tags_with_sha - finds any github actions within a workflow
                                          file and replaces the tag with the SHA

actionsReplaceTagsWithSha.title:
If the method is minder.actions.replace_tags_with_sha, this is the configuration
for that method

RemediatePullRequestRemediation.title: the name stutters a bit but we already use a PullRequest message for handling PR entities

inEntity.description:
in_entity is the entity in which the rule is evaluated.
This can be repository, build_environment or artifact.

ruleSchema.description: rule_schema is the schema of the rule. This is expressed in JSON Schema.

paramSchema.description:
param_schema is the schema of the parameters that are passed to the rule.
This is expressed in JSON Schema.

RuleTypeDefinition.description: Definition defines the rule type. It encompases the schema and the data evaluation.

contentType.description: The HTTP Content-Type header value specifying the content type of the body.

data.description: The HTTP request/response body as raw binary.

extensions.description:
Application specific response metadata. Must be set in the first response
for streaming APIs.

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com. As of May 2023, there are no widely used type server
implementations and no plans to implement one.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.

v1ArtifactType.description: ArtifactType defines the artifact data evaluation.

context.description: context is the context in which the role assignment is evaluated.

roleAssignment.description: role_assignment is the role assignment to be created.
role_assignment is the role assignment that was created.

v1BuiltinType.description: BuiltinType defines the builtin data evaluation.

v1Context.description:
Context defines the context in which a rule is evaluated.
this normally refers to a combination of the provider, organization and project.

Removing the 'optional' keyword from the following two fields below will break
 buf compatibility checks.

ruleType.description: rule_type is the rule type to be created.

v1CreateRuleTypeRequest.description: CreateRuleTypeRequest is the request to create a rule type.

ruleType.description: rule_type is the rule type that was created.

v1CreateRuleTypeResponse.description: CreateRuleTypeResponse is the response to create a rule type.

v1DeleteRuleTypeResponse.description: DeleteRuleTypeResponse is the response to delete a rule type.

ecosystems.description:
ecosystems is the list of ecosystems to be used
for the "dep" diff type.

type.description:
type is the type of diff ingestor to use.
The default is "dep" which will leverage
the ecosystems array.

v1DiffType.description: DiffType defines the diff data ingester.

v1Entity.description: Entity defines the entity that is supported by the provider.

profileStatus.title: profile_status is the status of the profile

ruleEvaluationStatus.title: rule_evaluation_status is the status of the rules

profileStatus.title: profile_status is the status of the profile

v1GetRuleTypeByIdResponse.description: GetRuleTypeByIdResponse is the response to get a rule type by id.

v1GetRuleTypeByNameResponse.description: GetRuleTypeByNameResponse is the response to get a rule type by name.

cloneUrl.description: clone_url is the url of the git repository.

branch.description: branch is the branch of the git repository.

v1GitType.description: GitType defines the git data ingester.

cursor.title: cursor is the cursor to use for the next page of results, empty if at the end
cursor is the cursor to use for the next page of results, empty if at the end

ruleTypes.description: rule_types is the list of rule types.

v1ListRuleTypesResponse.description: ListRuleTypesResponse is the response to list rule types.

context.description: context is the context in which the profile is evaluated.

id.description:
id is the id of the profile.
This is optional and is set by the system.

name.description: name is the name of the profile instance.

repository.description: These are the entities that one could set in the profile.

remediate.title:
whether and how to remediate (on,off,dry_run)
this is optional as the default is set by the system

alert.title:
whether and how to alert (on,off,dry_run)
this is optional as the default is set by the system

type.description: type is a placeholder for the object type. It should always be set to "profile".

version.title: version is the version of the profile type. In this case, it is "v1"

v1Profile.description: Profile defines a profile that is user defined.

profileId.title: profile_id is the id of the profile

profileName.title: profile_name is the name of the profile

profileStatus.title: profile_status is the status of the profile

lastUpdated.title: last_updated is the last time the profile was updated

name.description: name is the name of the provider.

project.description: project is the project where the provider is.

version.description: version is the version of the provider.

implements.description: implements is the list of interfaces that the provider implements.

config.description: config is the configuration of the provider.

v1ProviderType.description: ProviderType is the type of the provider.

roleAssignment.description: role_assignment is the role assignment that was removed.

id.title: This is optional when returning remote repositories

endpoint.description:
endpoint is the endpoint to fetch data from.
This can be a URL or the path on the API.bool
This is a required field and must be set.
This is also evaluated via a template which allows
us dynamically fill in the values.

method.description: method is the method to use to fetch data.

headers.description: headers are the headers to be sent to the endpoint.

body.description: body is the body to be sent to the endpoint.

parse.description: parse is the parsing mechanism to be used to parse the data.

fallback.description:
fallback provides a body that the ingester would return in case
the REST call returns a non-200 status code.

v1RestType.description:
RestType defines the rest data evaluation.
This is used to fetch data from a REST endpoint.

name.description: name is the name of the role.

description.description: description is the description of the role.

role.description: role is the role that is assigned.

subject.description: subject is the subject to which the role is assigned.

project.description: projectt is the projectt in which the role is assigned.

profileId.title: profile_id is the id of the profile

ruleId.title: rule_id is the id of the rule

ruleName.title: rule_name is the type of the rule. Deprecated in favor of rule_type_name

entity.title: entity is the entity that was evaluated

status.title: status is the status of the evaluation

lastUpdated.title: last_updated is the last time the profile was updated

entityInfo.title: entity_info is the information about the entity

details.title: details is the description of the evaluation if any

guidance.title: guidance is the guidance for the evaluation if any

remediationStatus.title: remediation_status is the status of the remediation

remediationLastUpdated.title: remediation_last_updated is the last time the remediation was performed or attempted

remediationDetails.title: remediation_details is the description of the remediation attempt if any

ruleTypeName.title: rule_type_name is the name of the rule

ruleDescriptionName.title: rule_description_name is the name to describe the rule

v1RuleEvaluationStatus.title: get the status of the rules for a given profile

id.description:
id is the id of the rule type.
This is mostly optional and is set by the server.

name.description: name is the name of the rule type.

context.description: context is the context in which the rule is evaluated.

def.description: def is the definition of the rule type.

description.description: description is the description of the rule type.

guidance.description: guidance are instructions we give the user in case a rule fails.

v1RuleType.description:
RuleType defines rules that may or may not be user defined.
The version is assumed from the folder's version.
